newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austria's ATX bolts to record close for 5th day.
newsitem.headline: Austria's ATX bolts to record close for 5th day.

text.p: Austria's ATX index of 21 blue chips continued its bull run on Friday, ending at a record closing high for the fifth day.

But the index, which ended 0.49 percent higher at 1,388.18, was driven off earlier highs as a flurry of profittaking kicked in, and traders said that while 1,400 points was within easy reach, the danger of a technical correction was mounting.

"Not quite 100 points in one week. That doesn't leave that much more to be desired," said one trader in reference to the rally which has taken the ATX's gains to around seven percent since last Friday.
"The air was already pretty thin up there," said another trader, adding that profit-taking set in once the ATX hit a record intra-day high at 1,401.66 points.

But underlying market sentiment remains very positive. "The futures contract is still very bullish. It could continue on," said a trader. But others said that a correction would be healthy and sensible for the market.
Winners outpaced losers with 13 ATX shares advancing, seven falling and one unchanged by the close.
The day's best performing ATX stock was brewery Brau Union, up 3.55 percent at 845 schillings while high-grade steelmaker Boehler-Uddeholm led decliners, losing 3.24 percent to 987 schillings.
The broad-based Vienna bourse index added on 0.46 percent to 499.32 points.
The July ATX future rose 6.5 points to 1,396.0 on volume of 1,713 contracts.
